subsections.title: 16.1. Entrepreneur Commitments
subsections.content: By signing above, I agree to the following terms and conditions, which are integral to the investment agreement:

16.1.1 Reporting & Milestone Tracking Integrity: I commit to providing timely and accurate reports on the project/business journey. I understand and agree that there shall be no gaps in the project/business journey markdown's milestone tracking component attributed to my reporting.
16.1.2 Safeguards Against Loss: I commit to implementing and maintaining reasonable safeguards to protect against capital and revenue loss related to the invested project/business.

16.1.3 Access to Operations & Records: I agree to provide the Investor(s) with reasonable access to the project/business operations and all related financial records, as and when required, in accordance with the terms agreed upon.

16.1.4 Upholding Agreements & Timely Payments: I commit to upholding all agreements entered into on this platform, including but not limited to, making all stipulated payments (e.g., dividends, interest, repayments) precisely on time according to the provided dates and schedules.

16.1.5 Open Communication Channels: I commit to maintaining open, transparent, and regular communication channels with the Investor(s) throughout the entire course of the investment, promptly addressing inquiries and providing updates.

16.1.6 Regulatory Compliance: I confirm that the project/business will operate in full compliance with all relevant government regulations, laws, and statutory requirements applicable in its jurisdiction (Matabeleland and Zimbabwe).

16.1.7 Confidentiality: I agree to maintain strict confidentiality regarding sensitive business contents and proprietary information shared by or with the Investor(s) and the Abathwa Capital platform, as defined in any separate Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) or the platform's terms.

16.1.8 Fund Utilization & Repurposing: I commit to using the received funds solely for the requested and approved purposes as outlined in the investment proposal. Should any repurposing of funds become necessary, I will apply for explicit authority and obtain written approval from the Investor(s) prior to such repurposing.

nda_section.title: 16.2. Non Disclosure Agreement
nda_section.content: This Non-Disclosure Agreement (hereinafter "Agreement"), effective as of this day the Agreement has been signed, is made and entered into BY AND BETWEEN: Abathwa Incubator PBC duly incorporated and existing under the laws of Zimbabwe, with its principal place of business at 849 Mawabeni, Esigodini, (hereinafter "Disclosing Party"); AND The investment recipient, (hereinafter "Receiving Party"). (The Disclosing Party and Receiving Party are hereinafter collectively referred to as "Parties" and individually as "Party"). WHEREAS, the Parties are engaging in discussions regarding potential Investment opportunities, business collaborations, due diligence and other related issues (the "Purpose"); WHEREAS, in connection with the Purpose, the Disclosing Party may disclose to the Receiving Party certain confidential, proprietary, and/or sensitive information; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, the Parties agree as follows:

subsections.title: 16.2.1. DEFINITION OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
subsections.content: "Confidential Information" means any and all information, whether oral, written, electronic, visual, or in any other form, disclosed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party, directly or indirectly, before or after the Effective Date, related to the Purpose, including but not limited to: a. Business plans, business partners, strategies, marketing plans, customer lists, investor lists, financial information, forecasts, and projections. b. Technical data, research, product ideas, designs, specifications, software (source code and object code), algorithms, processes, inventions, and intellectual property. c. Proprietary information, trade secrets, know-how, and methodologies. d. Information concerning employees, contractors, partners, and other third parties. e. Any information designated by the Disclosing Party as confidential, proprietary, or secret at the time of disclosure or generally regarded as secret by business, national and general standards as well as data and privacy protection laws. f. Any information derived from or created by the Receiving Party that contains, reflects, or is based upon, in whole or in part, any Confidential Information.

subsections.title: 16.2.2. EXCLUSIONS FROM CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
subsections.content: Confidential Information shall not include information that: a. Is or becomes publicly available through no fault or breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party. b. Was rightfully known to the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party, without breach of any confidentiality obligation. c. Is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction as to disclosure, and without breach of any confidentiality obligation. d. Is independently developed by the Receiving Party without reference to or use of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information. e. Is disclosed with the prior written approval of the Disclosing Party.

subsections.title: 16.2.3. OBLIGATIONS OF RECEIVING PARTY
subsections.content: The Receiving Party agrees: a. To maintain all Confidential Information in strict confidence and to use the same degree of care to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care. b. To use the Confidential Information solely for the Purpose stated herein and for no other purpose whatsoever. c. Not to disclose, copy, reproduce, distribute, or otherwise make available the Confidential Information to any third party, except to its employees, directors, officers, agents, and advisors (collectively, "Representatives") who have a legitimate need to know such information for the Purpose and who are bound by confidentiality obligations no less restrictive than those contained herein. The Receiving Party shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its Representatives. d. To notify the Disclosing Party immediately upon discovery of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information.

subsections.title: 16.2.4. REQUIRED DISCLOSURE
subsections.content: If the Receiving Party is required by law, regulation, or by the order of a court or governmental agency to disclose any Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall: a. Provide the Disclosing Party with prompt prior written notice of such requirement (to the extent legally permissible) so that the Disclosing Party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. b. Cooperate with the Disclosing Party in its efforts to obtain such a protective order or other remedy. c. If a protective order or other remedy is not obtained, disclose only that portion of the Confidential Information that is legally required, and use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to the disclosed information.

subsections.title: 16.2.5. RETURN OR DESTRUCTION OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
subsections.content: Upon the written request of the Disclosing Party, or upon the termination of discussions concerning the Purpose, the Receiving Party shall promptly return to the Disclosing Party or destroy all Confidential Information (and all copies, extracts, analyses, and other reproductions thereof) disclosed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party. The Receiving Party shall certify in writing to the Disclosing Party that all Confidential Information has been returned or destroyed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Receiving Party may retain copies of Confidential Information solely to the extent required by applicable law, regulation, or its internal compliance policies, provided that such retained copies remain subject to the confidentiality obligations of this Agreement.

subsections.title: 16.2.6. TERM AND SURVIVAL
subsections.content: This Agreement shall become effective on the Effective Date of the Agreement and shall remain in full force and effect until 7 years from the Effective Date, or until such time as the Confidential Information ceases to be confidential as set forth in Section 2, whichever occurs later. The obligations of confidentiality hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement for the specified term.

subsections.title: 16.2.7. NO LICENSE OR WARRANTY
subsections.content: This Agreement does not grant the Receiving Party any right, title, interest, or license, express or implied, in or to any Confidential Information, or any intellectual property rights of the Disclosing Party. All Confidential Information is provided "AS IS" and without any warranty, express or implied, regarding its accuracy or completeness.

subsections.title: 16.2.8. REMEDIES
subsections.content: The Receiving Party acknowledges that a breach of this Agreement would cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party for which monetary damages alone would not be an adequate remedy. Accordingly, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief (in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity) to prevent any actual or threatened unauthorized use or disclosure of its Confidential Information.

subsections.title: 16.2.9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
subsections.content: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Zimbabwe, without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Zimbabwe.

subsections.title: 16.2.10. ENTIRE AGREEMENT
subsections.content: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties concerning the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, between the Parties.

subsections.title: 16.2.11. AMENDMENT
subsections.content: This Agreement may only be amended or modified by a written instrument duly executed by both Parties.

subsections.title: 16.2.12. SEVERABILITY
subsections.content: If any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the validity, legality, and enforceability of the remaining provisions shall not in any way be affected or impaired thereby.

subsections.title: 16.2.13. COUNTERPARTS
subsections.content: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
